member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntime
member.summary: Represents the runtime for executing durable functions and orchestrations. This is the main entry point for registering functions and managing orchestration execution.
member.remarks: The runtime provides thread-safe execution of durable functions with built-in support for: - Concurrent orchestrator execution with lease-based coordination - Automatic state persistence and recovery - Function call replay-safety for orchestrators - External event handling and timer support - Distributed execution across multiple hosts

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions
member.summary: Configuration options for customizing the behavior of the DurableFunctionRuntime. These options control polling intervals, concurrency limits, error handling, and execution strategies.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.PollingIntervalMs
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval in milliseconds between polling operations when no work is available.
member.value: The polling interval in milliseconds. Default is 100ms for responsive execution.
member.remarks: Lower values provide more responsive execution but increase CPU usage when idle. Higher values reduce CPU usage but may delay execution of scheduled functions. Consider your application's latency requirements when setting this value.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.MaxConsecutiveErrors
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of consecutive errors before stopping the polling loop.
member.value: The maximum consecutive error count. Default is 10. Set to -1 for unlimited retries.
member.remarks: This setting prevents runaway error conditions from consuming resources indefinitely. When the limit is reached, the runtime will stop polling and throw an exception. Set to -1 to disable error limiting, but ensure proper error handling in your functions.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.UseCooperativeYield
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to enable cooperative orchestration yielding using a custom task scheduler.
member.value: True to use cooperative yielding (default), false to use exception-based yielding.
member.remarks: Cooperative yielding provides better performance and cleaner stack traces by using a custom task scheduler instead of exceptions for orchestration flow control. This is the recommended setting for production. Set to false only if you encounter compatibility issues or need to debug orchestration flow.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.MaxConcurrentFunctionExecutions
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of functions that may execute concurrently.
member.value: The concurrency limit. Defaults to 4x processor count, clamped between 8 and 128. Set to 0 or negative values to disable concurrency limiting.
member.remarks:
This setting controls the maximum number of functions (both activities and orchestrators) that can execute simultaneously. Higher values allow more concurrent execution but consume more system resources. Lower values reduce resource usage but may limit throughput.
The default calculation (4x processor count) provides a good balance for most scenarios. Consider your system's memory and I/O capacity when adjusting this value.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.DefaultLeaseDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets the default lease duration for concurrent orchestrator execution. If not specified, defaults to 5 minutes.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.HostId
member.summary: Gets or sets the host ID for lease management in concurrent orchestrator execution. If not specified, defaults to Environment.MachineName + "-" + Environment.ProcessId.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.SchedulingMiddlewares
member.summary: Gets the collection of scheduling middleware invoked before durable state is persisted.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.ExecutionMiddlewares
member.summary: Gets the collection of execution middleware invoked when orchestrators and activities run.

member.name: P:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions.TraceStateOperations
member.summary: Enables tracing spans for state persistence operations (save/load/remove). Disabled by default to reduce noise.

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.JsonFunctionDelegate
member.summary: Represents a durable function that processes JSON input and produces JSON output asynchronously. Functions should be deterministic and idempotent as they may be called multiple times during replay scenarios.
member.param: The function execution context providing access to logging and runtime services.
The JSON string input to process. May be null or empty depending on the function requirements.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous function execution. The task result contains the JSON output string.
member.remarks: Functions must be stateless and should not have side effects that affect replay behavior. Use the provided context for logging and accessing runtime services. The input parameter contains the serialized data passed to the function.

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.JsonOrchestratorDelegate
member.summary: Represents a durable orchestrator function that coordinates the execution of multiple activities and manages workflow state. Orchestrators must be deterministic and replay-safe to ensure consistent behavior across executions.
member.param: The orchestration context providing access to durable operations like calling activities, creating timers, and waiting for events.
The JSON string input provided when the orchestration was started. May be null or empty.
member.returns: A task that represents the asynchronous orchestration execution. The task result contains the final JSON output of the orchestration.
member.remarks:
Orchestrators must follow these rules for correct replay behavior: - Only interact with external systems through context methods (CallAsync, CreateTimer, WaitForEvent) - Do not use non-deterministic operations like DateTime.Now, Random, or network calls directly - Avoid accessing non-deterministic data or performing I/O operations outside of activities - Use the orchestration context for all durable operations to ensure proper state management
Orchestrators are automatically deleted from storage upon successful completion unless a timer is set.

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions
member.summary: Extension methods for configuring Durable Functions services in a dependency injection container. These extensions provide convenient registration of runtime components with different storage backends.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDurableFunctionsManagement(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.DurableFunctionsManagementOptions})
member.summary: Adds Durable Functions orchestration management services to the service collection. This includes the management service, orchestration client, and HTTP API controllers for managing orchestrations.
member.param: The service collection to add services to. Cannot be null.
Optional configuration action for customizing management service options.
member.returns: The service collection for fluent chaining.
member.remarks:
This method registers the following services: - IOrchestrationManagementService (scoped) - IOrchestrationClient (scoped) - MVC controllers with HTTP endpoints for orchestration management
Requires that DurableFunctionRuntime is already registered in the service collection.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDurableFunctionsManagementService(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.String)
member.summary: Adds minimal Durable Functions orchestration management services without HTTP controllers. Use this when you want to use the management service directly without the built-in HTTP endpoints.
member.param: The service collection to add services to. Cannot be null.
Optional base URL for generating management URLs in responses. Defaults to empty string.
member.returns: The service collection for fluent chaining.
member.remarks:
This method registers the following services: - IOrchestrationManagementService (scoped) - IOrchestrationClient (scoped)
Unlike AddDurableFunctionsManagement, this method does not register MVC controllers. Requires that DurableFunctionRuntime is already registered in the service collection.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDurableFunctionsWithPostgreSQL(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.String,System.Action{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions})
member.summary: Adds Durable Functions runtime with PostgreSQL state store for production deployments.
member.param: The service collection to add services to. Cannot be null.
PostgreSQL connection string. Must be a valid connection string.
Optional configuration action for customizing runtime options such as concurrency limits and polling intervals.
member.returns: The service collection for fluent chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when is empty or whitespace.
member.remarks:
This method registers: - PostgreSqlStateStore as IStateStore (singleton) - DurableFunctionRuntime (singleton)
PostgreSQL provides production-ready durability and supports multi-host deployments with lease-based coordination. The connection string should include all necessary parameters for connecting to PostgreSQL.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDurableFunctionsWithSQLite(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.String,System.Action{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions})
member.summary: Adds Durable Functions runtime with SQLite state store for single-node deployments and development.
member.param: The service collection to add services to. Cannot be null.
SQLite connection string. Can use file path or ":memory:" for in-memory database.
Optional configuration action for customizing runtime options such as concurrency limits and polling intervals.
member.returns: The service collection for fluent chaining.
member.exception: Thrown when is empty or whitespace.
member.remarks:
This method registers: - SqliteStateStore as IStateStore (singleton) - DurableFunctionRuntime (singleton)
SQLite provides good performance for single-node deployments and is ideal for development and testing. For production multi-host deployments, consider using PostgreSQL instead. The database schema will be automatically created if it doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Extensions.ServiceCollectionExtensions.AddDurableFunctionsWithInMemory(Microsoft.Extensions.DependencyInjection.IServiceCollection,System.Action{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Core.DurableFunctionRuntimeOptions})
member.summary: Adds Durable Functions runtime with in-memory state store for development and testing scenarios.
member.param: The service collection to add services to. Cannot be null.
Optional configuration action for customizing runtime options such as concurrency limits and polling intervals.
member.returns: The service collection for fluent chaining.
member.remarks:
This method registers: - InMemoryStateStore as IStateStore (singleton) - DurableFunctionRuntime (singleton)
WARNING: The in-memory state store does not persist data across application restarts. Use this only for development, testing, or scenarios where data loss is acceptable. For production deployments, use PostgreSQL or SQLite state stores instead.

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.InMemoryStateStore
member.summary: In-memory implementation of using concurrent collections with lease management. This implementation provides both basic state storage and concurrent-safe orchestrator execution for development and testing scenarios.
member.remarks:
WARNING: This implementation stores all data in memory and does not persist across application restarts. Use this implementation only for: - Development and testing scenarios - Temporary workflows where data loss is acceptable - Performance testing and benchmarking
For production deployments, use or instead.
The implementation is thread-safe and supports concurrent access from multiple threads. Lease management ensures only one host can execute a given orchestrator at a time.

member.returns: A new NpgsqlConnection instance.

member.name: T:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore
member.summary: SQLite implementation of for persistent storage of durable function state. Provides production-ready durability with concurrent orchestrator execution support using optimistic concurrency control and lease-based safety.
member.remarks:
SQLite provides excellent performance for single-node deployments and is ideal for: - Production single-instance applications - Development and testing environments - Edge computing scenarios - Desktop applications with durable workflows
Features: - Automatic database schema creation and migration - ACID transactions for data consistency - Optimistic concurrency control with version tracking - Lease-based coordination for safe orchestrator execution - Support for both file and in-memory databases - Connection pooling and automatic retry handling
For multi-host distributed deployments, consider using instead. The database schema is automatically created if it doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore.#ctor(System.String,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a connection string. The database schema will be automatically created if it doesn't exist.
member.param: The SQLite connection string. Use "Data Source=:memory:" for in-memory database or file paths for persistent storage.
Optional logger for debugging, monitoring, and error tracking.
member.exception: Thrown when is null, empty, or whitespace.
member.remarks: For in-memory databases, an anchor connection is maintained to prevent data loss when connections are closed. The connection string is automatically converted to use shared cache for in-memory databases to enable proper isolation.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore.#ctor(Microsoft.Data.Sqlite.SqliteConnection,Microsoft.Extensions.Logging.ILogger{Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with an existing connection.
member.param: An existing SQLite connection. The connection string will be extracted for creating additional connections as needed.
Optional logger for debugging, monitoring, and error tracking.
member.remarks: This constructor extracts the connection string from the provided connection and uses it to create additional connections as needed. For in-memory databases, the provided connection may be kept open as an anchor to prevent data loss. The database schema will be automatically created if it doesn't exist.

member.name: M:Asynkron.DurableFunctions.Persistence.SqliteStateStore.OpenConnection
member.summary: Creates a new connection for each operation to avoid concurrent access issues.
member.returns: A new opened SqliteConnection.

member.returns: True if it's an in-memory database, false otherwise.

member.returns: The converted connection string with shared cache if it's in-memory.
